intro: Acroelytrum japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese acroelytrum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Acroelytrum japonicum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
